title: best place to see
review: I was welcomed with a made up of the most fragrant air and birds are really good.  amazing view. There were three people in particular that took care of us which . They made our stay really comfortable, anything we needed they were there. The location is clean and tidy not to mention very spacious. The view from eys was amazing.  I would love to come back to this place!

title: Great and New Kind of Expriances
review: Its a beautiful place to see. i want to know about my great grand father who lived at India when hes working for British army, I found my family tree by help of St. Mary's church father. This is a beautiful place to see also.

title: Good Place
review: I had a pleasant time during my visit. Its a good buy in its segment. The surrounding here is very welcoming.....

title: Nice place
review: Its a nice place to come . But do it if you have lots of time to stay in the city and you have done everything else

title: Graveyard of St. Mary
review: St. Mary's Church Graveyard has numerous graves laid inside the premises.The tombs are a mix of Gothic and Indo-Saracenic style with marble plaques raised on a few of them.Many of the tombs belong to the British officers of the East India Company and their families.

title: Nothing great
review: I could not find anything great over here. Might be my taste is different but there was very less crowd as well.

title: Cemetery in Ajmer
review: One of the most historic Cemeteries in Ajmer, Contains a lot of British artefacts, Lots of birds and tombs. Gothic styles abound. Nice place for a 1 hour visit

title: Anglican cemetery in India
review: Nasirabad is a cantonment town in Ajmer district or subdistrict, I do not really understand. This is one of the main garrison towns of the British colonial army. And coincidentally the town where very early settled  Anglican missionaries.  St. Mary church, in fact, was actually built by them for the needs of British garrison. With the cemetery, where are buried many soldiers and officers. I have not seen here something particularly noteworthy, the anglican culture of the decoration of burial places  is still noticeably below and more ascetic than the followers of other religions have. Although this church in Nasirabad, as they say (unofficially, of course), has allegedly a sliver from the cross of the crucifixion of Jesus Christ.

title: Stay away if you are sensitive...
review: It is situated just adjecent to the Nasirabad railway station.

title: Nice Visit
review: St. Mary's Graveyard is one of the oldest & most coveted places of visit in Ajmer. However, the visit can be of short duration
